discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
NOT B because you DO want the import process to be automated, which is a feature of Data Loader.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.when_to_use_the_data_loader.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: ACD
remember User object is not supported by the Data Import Wizard

choices.B: You don't need the import process to be automated.
choices.D: You want to schedule regular data loads, such as nightly imports.
choices.A: You need to load 50,000 to five million records. If you need to load more than 5 million records, we recommend you work with a Salesforce partner or visit the AppExchange for a suitable partner product.
choices.C: You need to load into an object that is not supported by the Data Import Wizard.

questions.question_text: What objects are supported by the Import Wizard?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: F
All of the above

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.records_gen_info.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: You can export data from Salesforce using any of the following methods except __________.

discussion.content:
Answer is A. Use the data Manager tool to manually request an export of all the data in your organization.
Because "data manager" is not a tool.

The following are NOT the answer because they are methods you can use to export data (my best guess as to where each answer is documented):

B. Use the data Export wizard within SF to export data manually or automatically.
"From Setup, enter Data Export in the Quick Find box, then select Data Export and Export Now or Schedule Export."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.admin_exportdata.htm&type=5

C. Use the data loader client application.
"You can use the Data Loader export wizard to extract data from a Salesforce object."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.exporting_data.htm&type=5

D. Log a case with SF.
"Please log a case with Salesforce Support and be sure to include a detailed business impact and explanation, so that Salesforce Support may evaluate your request. Note: Creating multiple schedule export is currently not a Salesforce functionality yet."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000383962&type=1

choices.A: Use the data Manager tool to manually request an export of all the data in your organization.
choices.C: Use the data loader client application.
choices.B: Use the data Export wizard within SF to export data manually or automatically.

questions.question_text: When using the Data Export Wizard to manually export data, you can only export data if __________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"The Export Now option prepares your files for export immediately. This option is only available if enough time has passed since your last export."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.admin_exportdata.htm&type=5
The Export Now option prepares your files for export immediately. This option is only available if enough time has passed since your last export.

choices.C: Enough time has passed since your last export.
choices.A: Your data doesn't include attachments, images, or documents.
choices.B: You've installed a client application to export the data.

choices.D: Frequency, if your organization supports monthly exports

discussion.content: If you're scheduling your export, select the frequency (only available for orgs with monthly exports), start and end dates, and time of day for your export

questions.question_text: When scheduling automatic data exporting with the Data Export Wizard, you must specify all of the following except __________.
